title: Space Missions Recall
description: Match space missions to their achievements

questions.question: Which NASA mission successfully landed the first humans on the Moon in July 1969?
Which Soviet mission made Yuri Gagarin the first human to orbit Earth in 1961?
Which Apollo mission is famously known as a 'successful failure' after an oxygen tank explosion forced the crew to abort their Moon landing in 1970?
Which space telescope, launched in 1990, revolutionized astronomy with its deep-field images of distant galaxies?
Which NASA rover successfully landed on Mars in 2012 and is the size of a car, still operating on the red planet?
Which was the first reusable spacecraft, launching in April 1981 as STS-1?
Which twin spacecraft, launched in 1977, have traveled farther from Earth than any other human-made objects and carry golden records?
Which mission made Alan Shepard the first American in space in May 1961?
Which NASA mission flew by Pluto in 2015, providing the first close-up images of the dwarf planet?
Which joint US-Soviet mission in 1975 saw the first international handshake in space between astronauts and cosmonauts?
Which space station, launched in 1973, was America's first space station and hosted three crews?
Which mission orbited Saturn for 13 years (2004-2017) and dropped the Huygens probe onto Saturn's moon Titan?
Which was the last Apollo mission to land on the Moon in December 1972, featuring the longest lunar surface stay?
Which Mars rover, launched in 2020, carried the Ingenuity helicopter that achieved the first powered flight on another planet?
Which Soviet satellite, launched on October 4, 1957, was the first artificial object to orbit Earth?
